text:
The wrapper script adds all the jar files in ${ANT_HOME}/lib to a LOCALCLASSPATH.
The way the script is written, it breaks when ANT_HOME contains one or more blanks.

Note: The bug occurs on all platforms that execute bin/ant.
creator: antonioli@ifi.unizh.ch

text:
Are you sure this is Ant 1.4.1

The script has this
for %%i in ("%ANT_HOME%\lib\*.jar") do call "%ANT_HOME%\bin\lcp.bat" %%i

which should handle ANT_HOME values with spaces. What is the exact value of your
ANT_HOME that causes this problem.
creator: conor@apache.org

text:
I have to clarify:
the bug occurs when executing bin/ant, the sh script, which runs on all platforms,
not bin\ant.bat, the batch file, which runs only on some OS.

The problem is at statements like:
>
# add in the dependency .jar files
DIRLIBS=${ANT_HOME}/lib/*.jar
for i in ${DIRLIBS}
>
which should better read:
> 
# add in the dependency .jar files
DIRLIBS="${ANT_HOME}/lib"
for i in "${DIRLIBS}/"*.jar
do
>
creator: antonioli@ifi.unizh.ch
